courseName: Fictionalize Your Life: How To Keep A Writer's Diary
description:
About This Class
Since November 2020, I committed to the habit of keeping a writer's diary. It started with daily sketches of little events throughout my day, but eventually, the habit ballooned into a folder with over 300 short stories about my life. 
Writing is an art that's hard to define and practice, and I think it's very important to establish a daily routine of honing this craft. In this class, I will share some of the lessons I've learned from keeping my writer's diary every day for a whole year alongside some tips for starting your own daily practice. 
In this class you'll discover: 
What you should write about in your diary 
Why your life is someone else's fiction
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Instructions: 
Review the two diary-keeping episodes: the David Sedaris Method and the Truman Capote Method. 
Read the samples attached to the project page. 
Pick one of the techniques and produce a short piece of writing (300-500 words). 
Title/Post the short piece of writing to the project page and repeat the habit on a daily basis.
I look forward to reading your entries. :)

lessons.title: Your Reality Is Someone Else's Fiction
Benefits of Keeping a Writer's Diary

author: Robin Waldun

courseName: Document Your Life: 4 Methods to Live More Intentionally
description:
About This Class
In a world that feels incredibly fast moving and ephemeral, it can feel easy to get swept away with the distractions and temptations offered to us at every turn.
I designed and created this class to share with you my techniques for cutting through those distractions and bringing a lot of meaning and depth to everything that you do in life, big or small.
To do this, we're going to explore a concept that I call Intentional Documentation, which I consider to be a powerful alternative to auto piloting your way through life. In this class, we cover the principles of effective documentation, the right mindset to approach documenting your experiences, and a variety of analog and digital options.
I'll teach you 4 methods of Intentional Documentation:

1. Vlogging
2. Journaling
3. Photography
4. Reporting your own life
There is something beautiful about capturing pieces of your life in a thoughtful way, and having these moments to look back on. Their value is immeasurable. They can create a sort of loose outline of your past. They will become portals to see where you’ve come from and what you’ve been through. This class is all about the cultivation of those moments.
This class is for anyone interested in a change of pace from the fast-moving, information saturated world that we live in.
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
The project for this class is to try the 4 methods of intentional documentation and choose one to share a meaningful moment. Specific prompts are included at the ends of each of lesson, particularly in the second half of the class.
This isn’t about randomly snapping photos at whatever you see. It isn’t about journaling just because you’ve seen that get popular in the world of self help over the last few years. That doesn’t work.
To find a method that works for you, I encourage a mindset of experimentation. Feel free to test out any or all 4 of the methods that I cover.
Depending on what resonates, you can begin to think about ways to incorporate these new methods into your life over the long term. Start with one of the methods outlined in this class to document something meaningful that happened in your day or week. From there, think about creating a clear plan for yourself on how you can make this a regular practice in your life over the long term.

lessons.title: Method 4: Become a Reporter of Your Own Life

author: Nathaniel Drew

courseName: Copywriting For Beginners: How To Write Web Copy That Sells Without Being Cheesy
description:
About This Class
Copywriting for beginners. Lessons from a veteran web copywriter.
There is so much noise online. Literally millions of websites, social media posts, emails and advertising messages all competing for attention. 
If you want to cut through the noise, stand out from the competition and generate leads and sales, then you need to effectively communicate your message online.
Discover how to write web copy that sells your products and services (even if you’re a total beginner) with lessons from a professional copywriter with 14 years’ experience writing copy for 153 different industries.
This class is for beginners, experienced writers and anyone who wants to learn the fundamentals of writing for the web.
If you’ve ever struggled to come up with the right words to describe your business in an exciting and engaging way. Or if you’ve ever stared at a blank screen with no clue what to write next, then this class is for you!
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Write an attention-getting headline using the fill-in-the-blanks writing templates provided in the class project worksheet. Post your headline in the class dashboard to receive feedback and encouragement!

lessons.title: 5 Tips For Writing For The Web
How To Write Headlines That Get Attention
How To Write Meaningful Sub Headlines
Your Call To Action Micro Button Copy
Turn Boring Features Into Irresistible Benefits

author: Jesse Forrest

description:
About This Class
How do you write a story that feels alive? What makes a story different from an anecdote?
Join renowned urban fantasy writer Daniel José Older for a 40-minute dive into the fundamentals of narrative storytelling! 
Energetic, bite-sized lessons explore:
The "4 C's" of storytelling: character, conflict, context, and craft 
Breaking down how each "C" works in Older's short story, Salsa Nocturna 
Tools and questions to ask yourself as you're developing your own story 
This class is for creative writers (both aspiring and established), and everyone who wants a deeper understanding of what makes a great story so captivating. You'll leave this class armed with a tried-and-true framework for writing your own fictional short story, and inspired to put pen to paper.
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Write a short story about something that happened on a single block, in your hometown, over the course of one hour.
Read my short story Salsa Nocturna as a supplemental guide to the class (you can watch/listen to it in video form, or download a PDF version below).
   PRACTICE
You are in this class to write. You have your prompt – now go forth and create!
author: Daniel José Older

courseName: Creative Writing Bootcamp: Start a Brand New Story
description:
About This Class
Kick your writing into high gear with this fun, energetic class designed to answer the ever-present question for writers everywhere: What should I write about next?
Best-selling author Myla Goldberg (Feast Your Eyes, Bee Season) is here to help you find the idea that will become your next story (and the idea for the story after that, and the one after that, and... you get the idea). In this inventive class, you’re invited to write alongside Myla in real time as she guides you through five exercises specifically designed to transform you into an idea-generation machine. 
A seasoned teacher with a captivating and hilarious style, Myla has developed this process through years of experience, gleaned not only through her own writing but also the common struggles of writing students. With the help of an on-screen writing timer and prompts, you’ll move through quick, idea-generating exercises, including:
Using memory to write vivid settings
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Share one of your exercises!
A big part of the fun of writing is sharing it! Whichever exercises you enjoyed the most, we want to celebrate them with you. This is your chance to share what happened in that café between you and The Person You Don’t Like, your dialogue exercise, one of your scenes, or anything else inspired by the exercises.
Remember:
99.9% of all writing starts out as bad writing. Don’t overthink it!
Not every exercise may resonate with you, and that’s okay.
author: Myla Goldberg

courseName: The Creative Toolkit: 6 Techniques to Spark Original Ideas
description:
About This Class
If you want to come up with more original ideas, explore your creative process, and learn how to use tangible tools to expand your creative potential, this class is for you! 
In this class, teacher, author, and comedian Esteban Gast breaks down the science of creativity and shares how the right systems and processes can create better ideas. 
Esteban gets it, he’s sat at his desk and waited for good ideas to come to him. He’s been jealous of other people’s ideas wondering why the muse didn’t visit him. So, in this course, there is no muse musings. It’s focused on building a toolkit of creativity that you can use regardless of your creative medium whether it be visual art, writing, music, entrepreneurship and beyond.
The creative toolkit that you’ll learn includes following techniques:
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
The objective for this class is for you to build meaningful habits in creative ideation.  To make this happen:
Try to complete the activities associated with each of the 6 tools.  If some of the tools don't resonate with you, try to do as many of them as possible. Trying out at least 3 of the tools is ideal so that you can determine which tools are most useful for your own creative process.  Upload an image of your work in the tools to your class project.
Fill out the Creative Toolkit worksheet, or just share your written responses to the prompts in your class project:
Your summary of how creativity works (for you)
What are the 3 most useful tools for your creative process, and when/how will you use them?
author: Esteban Gast

courseName: Character-Driven Story Development for Your Novel or Screenplay
description:
About This Class
In this class we use character-driven insights to flesh out your story's three main characters:
The Protagonist / Hero
The Antagonist 
The Ally
We use character-driven insights to achieve the following:
Identify the major components of your STORY. 
Define your Hero and understand his motives, goals, and limitations.
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
The class project consists of the 8 worksheets you will complete to help you understand your characters better and flesh out the details of your story. 
Each worksheet corresponds to a video lesson. Each lesson is around 10 minutes long, and each worksheet should take you less than 15 minutes to complete. 
By the end of this workshop, you'll have a blueprint of your story, which includes a breakdown of your three main characters: The Protagonist, The Antagonist, The Ally. As well as the major conflicts and beats within your story. You'll have a better sense of the relationships, motivations, and dynamics between these characters, and know with far more clarity how these characters might react emotionally and physically to the events within your story.

lessons.title: The Flaw Becomes A Special Skill
The Special Skill Creates Transformed Action

author: Ellie Shoja

courseName: How to Use Procreate 5X: Fresh Filters, Features, and More
description:
About This Class
The new Procreate 5x update is full of fun new filters and features. But where do you find them? Where is the private layer? What can you use the new selection tools for? What ARE all the new features anyway? If you're looking for a quick way to get up to speed on the on the new features in Procreate 5x, this is the class for you.

If you're new to Procreate, I'd recommend my Intro to Procreate class first. We won't be going over any basics in this class: we're gonna cut straight to the chase. What are the new features, where can you find them, and tips and tricks for taking advantage of them. So, let's get started!
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
I’ve made a Gesture Cheatsheet for you! It’s a quick visual reminder of the different gestures in Procreate. Click here get the Gesture Cheatsheet. 

Your project is to share a piece of art using one of the new adjustment filters to create a piece of art. You can use a piece of art you already have or you can come up with something completely new.

Note: you must be using the Skillshare WEBSITE to create or update your project. You cannot use the app.

Want More?
I also share my favorite art tips, tutorials, and other resources for artists via e-mail.

lessons.title: How to Use Procreate 5X: Fresh Filters, Features, and More
Color Updates: SwatchDrop, Auto Palettes, and Selection Color Fills
Canvas Widgets on iPad Home Screen

author: Brooke Glaser

courseName: Learn Indie Filmmaking By Making a Short Film
description:
About This Class
My name is Olaf, I am a do-it-yourself filmmaker with over two-decade experience. Through my film career, I've directed actors like Academy Nominee Florence Pugh (Black Widow, Little Women), James Cosmo (Braveheart), Johnathan Price (Brazil), Michael Imperioli (Sopranos), JJ Field (Captain America), to name a few.
> Note: IF YOU FINISH this class, you're eligible for my free Film Seminar via Zoom every Saturday, visit my website in my profile for more information.
In this class, I'll share all the tools that I've learned by completing twelve feature films. In this step-by-step guide to Indie Filmmaking, you'll teach yourself how to complete a short film independently through manageable action steps
[BE SURE TO CHECK OUT MY OTHER CLASS ON INDIE FILMMAKING]
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
By the end of this class, you will have created and completed a short film independently.
How? You might ask. We'll start with your ORIGINAL idea and you'll take direct action as we (well, you) work through it by using the tools that have enabled me to complete 12 feature films. I'll share all my tools and resources through these steps
[BE SURE TO CHECK OUT MY OTHER CLASS ON INDIE FILMMAKING]
author: Olaf De Fleur

courseName: How to Write a Personal Statement - The Complete Medicine Masterclass
description:
About This Class
In this class, we're going to be crafting together your very own expert personal statement. For a lot of us, the personal statement is often the most important thing that we'll ever write. It's the thing that'll determine the next 4-6 years of our lives. So it's easy to see the importance of making sure it's the best it can be. My name's Shaene and I'm a doctor, Cambridge University Graduate and Oxford University Supervisor - and I'll be taking you from the beginning to the end of your personal statement journey. 
Part One - Building Blocks
In the first few lessons, we're first going to be looking at the expertly designed 8 pillar framework based on personal statements of students who were accepted into Oxbridge and other top ranking universities. These 8 pillars will form the basis of your thought process and help you decide what to include in the personal statement. Think of these pillars as the building blocks.
We're going to spend some time learning how best to reflect on experiences in ways that show the reader that you are someone who is capable of extracting lessons and developing for the better as a result of it.
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Class Project
The project for this class is of course to create your own amazing personal statements! However, be weary of sharing them online, especially if you're applying this year and please do not exactly copy any of the examples given, but use them to inspire your own ideas! So with this in mind, it'll be more sensible for everyone to submit the class project as their Key Quality Table so we can give feedback on what belongs where and how strong the experience is! 
Useful Resources
Doctor Shaene's Personal Statement Guide
author: Doctor Shaene

projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
In this class I will be showing you my skills and thoughts about brushlettering. It is a basic class just about the brushlettering itself, not about procreate and also not about what fun you can all do with it. That will be in a later class. You can even follow the class with a brushpen and actual paper. Perhaps not as much fun as I would it to be, but you have to learn to ride the bike first before you can make beautyful trips. Sad but true...
I still hope you will enjoy the class and the skills I will teach you. 
So get the brushset en the canvas below and let's get started. Please make sure to post you project as in one word or perhaps a quote or the bonus project in the projectsection of this class afterwards and please do leave a review of the class. Thank you 
Have fun!

lessons.title: Brush explanation and warm up strokes
Walk through of the capital letters

author: Brenda Bakker

courseName: Write Your Screenplay: The Craft of Story, Structure and Script
description:
About This Class
Fade in...
"The struggling screenwriter punches the delete button until the page is blank then slams the laptop closed."
Write Your Screenplay aims to prevent this scenario from happening ever again by demystifying the stages of the screenwriting process and showing you how to put them into practice, leading you towards a well developed and complete screenplay.
Learn the language of screenwriting
Phrases like three act structure, conflict and character arc are thrown around the writers' room. This class covers all the main concepts in screenwriting and explains how to use them to generate ideas.
Develop your original idea into a complete story
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Write Your Screenplay takes you though the development process to completing your first draft. We don't want you to share your entire screenplay on here - it's too valuable! So there are three class projects to share and get feedback on which will help you develop your idea:.
1. Logline. Write your logline and share it. Let's see if it communicates the idea and engages us.
2. Three Act Structure. Complete your three act structure (using the handy guide provided). Let's see if your story is ready to go to the script phase.
3 Showcase Scene. Complete your first draft and share one scene that really shows off your skills. We'll see if you've taken in the screenwriter's toolkit and put into practice your structure, before seeing it through with a brilliantly written scene, with dynamic action and dialogue.
author: Joshua Dickinson

courseName: 5 Essay Writing Classes in Less than 1 Hour
description:
About This Class
Join teacher, Shellie, for this collection of her classes to get started in how to write essays and how academic writing differs from other forms of writing.
Shellie is completing her second masters qualification and will soon be a qualified librarian.
She shares her knowledge to help you achieve better university grades.
This class package covers:
- What is academic writing
- Essay introductions
projectDescription:
Hands-on Class Project
Take what you have learned from these classes and apply them to the next university essay you need to write. Then share your experiences and results with the class :)
author: Shellie Cleaver
